author: Dominic Chopping
title: ‘Angry Birds’ Maker Rovio’s Shares Drop 45% After Revenue Warning
text:
Shares in Rovio Entertainment Ltd. fell 50% on Thursday after the company behind the “Angry Birds” mobile-gaming franchise showed its revenue growth is losing steam as it struggles to attract and retain new players. 
The stock’s decline to €4.94 apiece left it at less than half the price in a September initial public offering. The shares also suffered a sharp selloff in late November when Rovio reported disappointing earnings.
